To factor the polynomial 3x^3 - 15x^2 - 12x, we first look for the greatest common factor (GCF) of all the terms. The GCF of 3x^3, -15x^2, and -12x is 3x. We factor out the GCF:

3x(x^2 - 5x - 4)

Now we need to factor the quadratic expression inside the parentheses:

x^2 - 5x - 4

To factor this quadratic, we look for two numbers that multiply to -4 and add to -5. Those numbers are -4 and 1. So we can rewrite the quadratic as:

(x - 4)(x + 1)

Now, we put it all together:

3x(x^2 - 5x - 4) = 3x(x - 4)(x + 1)

So the factored form of the polynomial 3x^3 - 15x^2 - 12x is 3x(x - 4)(x + 1).
